titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian human head figurine with applique decoration

mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian ceramic figure depicting the head of a person with three appliqu√© adornments across the forehead as well as large ear spools. The eyes are narrowed but what look to be pupils are still visible. This highly detailed piece is painted or glazed in a rich brown pigment.
The nose of and part of the mouth has been chipped off revealing the paste of the ceramic. Other than a few more chips and scratches the figure is in good condition.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian figurines
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
